downloading through their official sources thank you i did my best to make sure this pattern is accurate and easy to understand however if you find any errors or typographical mistakes please let me know if you have questions regarding this pattern please join my facebook group crochet designs by nelly klos i will be happy to answer any questions you may have and the talented people in my group are also very helpful i really love to see posts of your finished work if you post your finished work on twitter or instagram please tag it with #nellyklos this inspires others who see your work and i will be able to see and love your post happy crocheting the suggested thread and hook sizes below will help you estimate the finished size of your doily however you can use any yarn you prefer along with the crochet hook size specifically recommended for your yarn your doily pattern will work in any size but the size of your finished project and the amount of yarn you will use will vary accordingly suggested materials cotton thread size 10 or roughly 50g/246 yards per skein 1 5 mm or 2 mm hook yardage 230 yards / 210 meters finished size 12 5 / 31 cm in diameter please read the «stitches & terms» section before beginning all stitches in this pattern are listed and/or explained unless they are explained within the round please refer to this section for any unexplained stitches join most rounds with a slip_stitch in the top of starting stitch unless otherwise noted «in next stitch» does not refer to chain stitches stitch counts for each round are listed at the end of the round pattern repeats for each round are marked with * and a different color groups of stitches are listed in parentheses or for a more professional look it is best to wash your finished piece by hand and block accordingly magic loop make a loop leaving a tail about 4 / 10 cm long make sure the tail end is on the bottom insert hook into the loop from front to back wrap the working yarn around the hook counterclockwise and pull the yarn through chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet tc triple crochet yarn over x 2 times dtr double treble_crochet yarn over x 3 times trtr triple treble_crochet yarn over x 4 times fp complete the stitch around the front post of the stitch indicated bp complete the stitch around the back post of the stitch indicated fp popcorn complete 4 fp double_crochet around the indicated stitch
